bullets.text: Fed revised Morgan Stanley’s stress capital buffer after reconsideration, adjusting its capital requirements ahead of next CCAR cycle.
August JOLTS: job openings unchanged; hires and separations little changed, signaling steady labor demand despite slowdown fears.
U.S. government to shut down after midnight as Congress fails funding bills, risking delays at IRS, SSA, federal services; markets largely shrugged.
Affordable Care Act premiums could jump 114% if enhanced subsidies expire, intensifying political fight driving shutdown standoff.
EU’s carbon border tax goes live soon, reshaping trade flows and penalizing high-emissions imports; U.S., China, India push back.
Nvidia’s market cap tops $4.5 trillion on a string of AI infrastructure deals, reinforcing dominance in data center compute.
OpenAI launches Sora 2 and a TikTok-like Sora app; stricter controls require approval to generate individuals in videos.
Amazon unveils new Echo devices for Alexa+, starting at $99, signaling renewed push to monetize generative AI assistants in homes.
U.S. takes stake in Lithium Americas’ Nevada project; shares surge 35%, highlighting strategic push for domestic EV battery materials.
Trump-Pfizer deal lowers prices on some drugs and exempts Pfizer from pharma tariffs, boosting the stock and launching TrumpRx site.
Boeing begins work on a 737 MAX replacement, aiming for greater efficiency amid competitive pressure from Airbus and China’s COMAC.
Nike posts surprise sales growth but warns holiday demand and tariffs may dent margins; turnaround may be uneven.
FTC sues Zillow and Redfin over alleged anticompetitive practices in online rentals, escalating scrutiny of real estate tech platforms.
Defense spending shifts toward startups: AI fighter jets, autonomous systems, and novel sensors attract capital as wartime needs evolve.
Study: Long Covid risk for children doubles after a second infection, underscoring benefits of reinfection prevention.
